body_text.text: . Growth curves of recombinant MHV-α viruses. Murine LR7 cells were inoculated at 1 MOI=1 with the recombinant and wild-type A59 strain viruses, respectively. At the indicated 2 times post infection, infectivity in the culture supernatants was assayed by TCID50 analysis. 3

Error bars represent 1 SEM, n=4. 4 Figure S4 . Morphology of negatively stained VSVΔG/GFP-Gα virus at neutral and low pH. 1 20% sucrose cushion purified stocks of VSVΔG/GFP-Gα, resuspended in TD buffer were 2 sequentially brought to pH 6.5 and to the final pH of 5.5. Samples were negatively stained and 3 imaged by electron microscopy. Three representative images for pH 6.5 and pH 5.5 are shown in 4 the left or right panel, respectively. 5

BIBREF0.title: Architecture of the SARS coronavirus prefusion spike

BIBREF1.title: Organization of two transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus membrane protein topologies within the virion and core

BIBREF2.title: A structural analysis of M protein in coronavirus assembly and morphology

FIGREF0.text: Virus entry kinetics of MHV and VSV as measured by their sensitivity to lysosomal 1 tropic agent NH 4 Cl. VSVΔG/GFP-G* and MHV-EGFPM were bound to cells on ice for 90 min 2 at MOI=1. Unbound virus was removed with ice-cold PBS, and cultures were shifted to 37°C by 3 adding warm medium. NH 4 Cl was added at the indicated time points to stop endosome 4 maturation and thus virus entry. At 8h post warming, infection was scored by FACS analysis of 5 GFP expression. Half maximum infection of VSV was obtained within 20 min, after 40 min 6 approximately 80% of the maximal number of infected cells was obtained. MHV appeared to 7 enter cells much slower and less synchronized. After about 50 min of warming only half 8 maximum infection was obtained, after 100 min approximately 60% of the maximal number of 9 infected cells was observed. Error bars in a & b represent 1SEM, n=3. Fluorescein signal dependence on the incubation on ice. LR7ΔM15 cells were 1 inoculated at an MOI of 10 with MHV-αN by binding the virus to the cells for 90 min on ice, 2 removal of unbound virus, and shifting of the cultures to 37°C for 100min. FDG was 3 administered by hypotonic shock and subsequently the samples were incubated on ice for the 4 indicated amount of time. β-galactosidase activity was measured by determining fluorescein 5 production using FACS. Intracellular α-tagged protein level in relation to β-galactosidase activity. 1 VSVΔG/Luc-Gα* (MOI=100) was bound to cells on ice. Unbound virus was washed off, and 2 culture temperature shifted to 37°C in the presence of CHX. At the indicated time points cells 3 were washed and trypsinized on ice. Fusion was assessed by β-galactosidase activity-driven 4 fluorescein production using FACS. In parallel samples cells were lysed and G-protein content 5 was measured by western blot analysis. Fluorescence microscopy of β-galactosidase activity in α-virus infected cells. 1 VSVΔG/Luc-Gα* virus was bound to ΔM15 transfected HEK293T cells on ice. Unbound virus 2 was washed off and culture temperature shifted to 37°C for the indicated time periods. Fusion-3 dependent β-galactosidase activity-driven fluorescein production in cells was visualized by wide-4 field fluorescence microscopy. Size bar corresponds to 250µm. Calculating virus binding and internalization using a standard curve. (a) Correlation 1 between β-galactosidase activity and amount of β-galactosidase protein with indicated linear 2 range. Increasing amounts of purified wild-type E. coli β-galactosidase were added to cell lysates 3 of LR7ΔM15 cells. Samples were probed with Beta-Glo® substrate and incubated for 40 min at 4 RT in the dark before measuring the β-galactosidase activity using a luminescence read-out. (b) 5 Linear range of the β-galactosidase activity of the standard curve. (c) Calculation of number of 6 active enzymes per well from the standard curve and correlation thereof with the estimated 7 number of N proteins present in the binding assay based on literature.[1-3] (d) Calculation of the 8 number of active enzymes per well from the standard curve and correlation thereof with the 9 estimated number N proteins per well in the internalization assay. 10
